metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: File handling is an important part of any application.
content.html: File handling is an important part of any application.

content.text: Java has several methods for creating, reading, updating, and deleting files.
content.html: Java has several methods for creating, reading, updating, and deleting files.

content.text: The File class from the java.io package, allows us to work with files.
content.html: The File class from the java.io package, allows us to work with files.

content.text: To use the File class, create an object of the class, and specify the filename or directory name:
content.html: To use the File class, create an object of the class, and specify the filename or directory name:

content.code:
import

java
.
io
.
File
;

// Import the File class



File
myObj
=

new

File
(
"filename.txt"
)
;

// Specify the filename
content.code_html:
import java.io.File;  // Import the File class

File myObj = new File("filename.txt"); // Specify the filename

content.text: If you don't know what a package is, read our Java Packages Tutorial .
content.html: If you don't know what a package is, read our Java Packages Tutorial.

content.text: The File class has many useful methods for creating and getting information about files. For example:
content.html: The File class has many useful methods for creating and getting information about files. For example:

content.code_html:
Method Type Description
canRead() Boolean Tests whether the file is readable or not
canWrite() Boolean Tests whether the file is writable or not
createNewFile() Boolean Creates an empty file
delete() Boolean Deletes a file
exists() Boolean Tests whether the file exists
getName() String Returns the name of the file
getAbsolutePath() String Returns the absolute pathname of the file
length() Long Returns the size of the file in bytes
list() String[] Returns an array of the files in the directory
mkdir() Boolean Creates a directory

content.text: You will learn how to create, write, read and delete files in the next chapters:
content.html: You will learn how to create, write, read and delete files in the next chapters:

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is a correct syntax to create a File object that represents a file called filename.txt?
content.html: What is a correct syntax to create a File object that represents a file called filename.txt?
